intro: Diplycosia abanii, commonly known as the Akanbi mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as Terminalia and Ficus species. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are red or orange in color and serve as a food source for various birds and mammals. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the growth and health of its host trees.
